I'm a digital note-taker/planner. Personally I use a hierarchical note-taking program called CherryTree. I kept both spiral-bound notebooks and binders when I was young but I found any methods to keep the pages in order. Luckily, during college and as a fledgling Linux user, I found various note-taking programs from Evernote to KeepNote to CherryTree. I drifted around between many of these and finally settled down on CherryTree. It gives me the power to create nodes within nodes in order to organize the games that I play and also GM. As a GM, the structure that works for me is the within the game system node that the game will be then I will have sub-nodes of the sessions (if not a one-shot), the setting, PC info, and NPC info. Within those sub-nodes, I create nodes based on what I need. Sometimes, I do that one more time before working on writing things in those nodes. Example: D&D > Torzukarr > Setting Info > Races.

Review

Pros

  • One file is created along how many backups you set up
  • Autosave
  • Anchoring within nodes with the ability to link nodes with each other, files, and hyperlinks

Cons

  • The font or the size can't be changed
  • Tables are weird
  • Headers only go to the third level
